ImageQuality.comm: Produces sharp photos with high optical quality.

cont.entity_a: Significantly improved photo quality when transitioning from JPEG/automatic to RAW/manual.
Autofocus is not supported on Nikon D5600; requires AF-S for autofocus. Autofocus is slower as it relies on the camera motor.

BuildQuality.comm: The lens is lightweight and inexpensive.

cont.entity_a: Built like a tank but feels fragile due to mostly plastic construction.
Compatible with Nikon D750 and produces crisp images. The lens does not focus on entry-level bodies.

Bokeh.comm: The lens is sharp with a good depth of field.

cont.entity_a: Great bokeh and depth, suitable for portraits and close-up work.
Great value for its price, but feels cheap compared to other Nikon lenses.
Manual operation is required for DX cameras without a focusing motor. Manual focusing is necessary for cameras without an internal focus motor.
Lacks included directions, making initial setup difficult.

Aperture.comm: Good for portraits with a large aperture.

cont.entity_a: Manual aperture control is available on the lens itself.
Noisy when focusing and lacks a lens protector.
Not suitable for sports or wildlife photography due to slower autofocus.
Not suitable for full-frame use as it lacks clarity on low aperture settings.
Satisfactory performance in low light with a wide aperture.
The lens fits loosely on the camera.
Minor sun flares occur when shooting around sunrise or sunset.
